subject: Marketing
title: The AIDA Formula
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The AIDA Formula.

hook.text: A 19th-century ad man mapped persuasion into four steps. Marketers still use them today.

buildup.text: AIDA stands for Attention, Interest, Desire, Actionâ€”the skeleton of persuasive writing.

discovery.text: Each step has one job: move the reader closer to the next step in the sequence.

twist.text: Most failed copy skips straight to Action without building Interest or Desire first.

climax.text: AIDA isn't a formula for lazy writers. It's a checklist that ensures nothing gets skipped.

punchline.text: Grab attention. Build interest. Create desire. Ask for action.

quiz.question: What does AIDA stand for in copywriting?
